comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: This is likely Pvt Joseph Norman Balmforth BALMFORTH, JOSEPH NORMAN Rank: Private Service No: PS/10915 Date of Death: 14/11/1916 Age: 23 Regiment/Service: Royal Fusiliers 23rd Bn. Grave Reference I. A. 32. Cemetery SERRE ROAD CEMETERY No.2 Additional Information: Son of John Walter Balmforth; husband of Martha Hannah Balmforth (formerly Clayton), of "Stoneleigh," 62, Saville Rd., South Shore, Blackpool. www.cwgc.org/find-war-dead/casualty/608083/BALMFORTH,%20J... Birth: unknown Death: Nov. 14, 1916 Note: Private, Royal Fusiliers. Age: 23. Burial: Serre Road Cemetery No. 2 Beaumont-Hamel Departement de la Somme Picardie, France Plot: I. A. 32. www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=56091023

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Joseph Norman Balmforth birth recorded 4th qr 1893 in Dewsbury Joseph N Balmforth marriage recorded to Martha H. Clayton 3rd qr 1915 in Dewsbury Martha H Balmforth death recorded 1st qr 1921 aged 29 in Fylde www.freebmd.org.uk J N Balmforth is commemorated on the Batley War Memorial, Kirklees, W Yorkshire (includes Dewsbury). www2.kirklees.gov.uk/community/warmemorial/images/batley_...

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: With both Joseph Norman Balmforth and Martha H Balmforth deceased, it is difficult to justify a link with the two Balmforth / Clayton births in 1938 and 1942 of Edward and David Balmforth in Halifax. www.freebmd.org.uk
